intro: Geissospermum martianum, commonly known as Martian glorybower, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. The plant produces small, green pods that contain seeds with a hard, woody coating. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in disturbed or open habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
